page.title: 10A HINDU TEMPLE IN SOUTHALL
page.content: At the beginning of Lady Margaret Road there is a{Hindu}Temple. There are many shrines around the room which is spacious and decorated throughout with the pictures of the gods and goddesses. You enter barefooted and the temple is carpeted in red. When you enter the temple you go up to the shrines and after you have paid your respects to them you ring a bell overhead. After this the priest will give you a few drops of holy water that you drink. He also gives sweets that others have donated. Anything that is donated is shared out in this way. Hindus believe that one should not be unkind to any creature and so they are vegetarians. In their worship they may sing{Bhajans}or hymns accompanied by tabla, harmoniums and percussion instruments. There is another Hindu temple in Southall.
